channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Minnesota board candidate who allegedly threw live tarantula at tenant is charged with assault
item.description: A candidate for the Hennepin County Board in Minnesota was arrested on assault charges after she was accused of throwing a live tarantula at her tenant.

item.title: Hundreds of millions at risk from Chinese shopping app malware
Football Manager 2025 is removing as many features as it’s adding
item.description: Fan can expect a new game engine and a new look in Football Manager 2025, while the social media page and touchline shouts are being axed.

item.title: Six things you can do right now to see if you're reading fake news
item.description: With polling day right around the corner, Dr Rebecca Whittington, Online Safety Editor at Reach, has revealed her tips on how to check if the information you're reading is the real deal or if it is fake

item.title: Watch: Manure truck crash covers Connecticut homes, yards in liquid feces
item.description: Residents of a Connecticut neighborhood are dealing with a stinky situation after a manure truck rolled over, collided with a car and spilled its odoriferous cargo.

item.title: Lakers, and rest of NBA, still on the clock: Will anyone draft Bronny James?
item.description: Bronny James is still available. The first round of the NBA Draft came and went Wednesday night without the name of LeBron James' son being called out at Barclays Center in Brooklyn.

item.title: Russian authorities detain suspect over St. Petersburg cafe blast
Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman are the ‘problem’ stopping Sherlock return
item.description: Co-creator Steven Moffat is still holding out hope though!

item.title: Island in Greece declares emergency due to water shortage amid deadly heatwave
item.description: The General Secretariat of Civil Protection has declared a 'state of emergency' on a Greek island due to a shortage of water in the blistering 50C heat that has killed six tourists

item.title: Watch: Kinkajou found at Washington rest stop gets temporary zoo home
item.description: A kinkajou, an animal native to the tropical rainforests ranging from Mexico to Brazil, was found wandering loose at a Washington rest stop.

item.title: Supreme Court blocks Purdue Pharma opioid settlement, threatening billions of dollars for victims
item.description: The Supreme Court blew up the massive bankruptcy reorganization of opioid maker Purdue Pharma, finding that the settlement inappropriately included legal protections for the Sackler family, meaning that billions of dollars secured for victims is now threatened.

item.title: READ: Trump indictment related to hush money payment
Inside Douglas is Cancelled Hugh Bonneville’s private life after split from wife of 25 years
item.description: Here's what we know about the Downton Abbey star's life away from the spotlight.

item.title: King Charles's subtle signs that he's 'feeling a little tired' after cancer bombshell
item.description: King Charles and Queen Consort, Camilla, kissed the Emperor and Empress of Japan goodbye today as their official three-day state visit to the UK drew to a close

item.title: Truck spills 8 tons of avocados onto California highway
item.description: Traffic was snarled for several hours on a California highway when a truck overturned and spilled its load of avocados into the road.

item.title: Kari Lake skips out on Arizona Senate GOP primary debate as she looks ahead to November
item.description: Kari lake, the frontrunner for the Republican Senate nomination in Arizona held a town hall. leaving Mark Lamb alone on the debate stage.

item.title: Trump pleads not guilty to 34 felony counts
14 things to do in London this weekend June 29 – 30
item.description: Amazing ice creams, the Euros and now Wimbledon - London summer is in full swing!

item.title: New driving laws in France Brits need to know to avoid fines of up to 135 euros
item.description: The Tour de France 2024 is set to take place in Italy and France, with cycling fans from around the world expected to travel to the two countries to watch the race

item.title: Man wins $1M lottery prize at store he has visited for 20 years
item.description: A Massachusetts man learned the value of loyalty when he won a $1 million lottery prize at the same store where he has bought tickets for 20 years.

item.title: How troops convicted under a gay sex ban can apply for a pardon from Biden
item.description: Many questions remain for veterans who were convicted under a military ban on gay sex and can now be pardoned — a move that could pave the way for military benefits.

item.title: The haunting Masters meltdown that changed Rory McIlroy's career
item.description: Slumped on his club, head buried in his arm, Rory McIlroy looked on the verge of tears.

item.title: Latest Glastonbury 2024 weather forecast sees temperatures nosedive
item.description: Hope you packed some hayfever medication.

item.title: 'I'm a dating expert – there's an intimate reason many couples divorce'
item.description: In 2022, a staggering 80,057 marriages in England and Wales ended in divorce. If you don't want to be part of this statistic, a relationship coach urges you to address this common problem head-on

item.title: Lost dog turns up 1,000 miles from home after 2 years
item.description: A Maryland man's lost dog turned up two years later after somehow ending up 1,000 miles from home.
